front.title: RSVP Domain of Interpretation for ISAKMP

abstract.t: RSVP does not provide dynamic key management for the RSVP Integrity object. It is difficult to provide security for RSVP based on standard security protocols. This draft proposes the usage of the ISAKMP protocol with a new Domain of Interpretation (DoI) and allows to establish the necessary security parameters for the RSVP Integrity object. The Integrity object protects RSVP signaling messages at the application layer and uses this DoI to dynamically establish the necessary security associations. This document also addresses the NSIS NTLP work and protocol design implications.
